p: Most of the antimalarial plant species identified are used for traditional management of other ailments in Kenya and in other countries. Ajuga remota Benth (different parts), for example, are used to relieve toothache, severe stomachache, oedema associated with protein-calorie malnutrition disorders in infants when breast-feeding is terminated, pneumonia, and liver problems [ 52, 104, 105]. Such plants are used across different ethnic communities for managing malaria and can be a justification of their efficacy in malaria treatment [ 19].
